metadata.title: Supplementary Material RAN TRANSLATION AND FRAMESHIFTING AS TRANSLATIONAL CHALLENGES AT SIMPLE REPEATS OF HUMAN NEURODEGENERATIVE DISORDERS

body_text.text: Each panel (a-w) shows the structure for a transcript with expanded repeats, its orientation (S-sense, AS-antisense) and the number of repeats identified in affected patients: a) DMPK/DM1, b) FMR1/FXTAS, c) ATXN8OS/SCA8, d) and e) ATXN1/SCA1, f) and g) ATXN2/SCA2, h) and i) ATXN3/SCA3, j) and k) HTT/HD, l) and m) AR/SBMA, n) and o) ATN1/DRPLA, p) and r) CACNA1A/SCA6, s) and t) JPH3/HDL2, u) and w) ZNF9/DM2. Structures were modeled in silico with RNAmetaserver or Mfold and visualized by Varna software. The modeling was performed for transcripts with 150 repeated nucleotides (50x trinucleotide and 25x hexanucleotide motifs), and, to obtain more relevant results, in two variants of the flanking sequence 200 and 100 nt each side. For figure clarity, we have shortened the hairpins formed by the expanded repeats, as well as the flanking sequence, to ~50 nt of 5' flank. In each panel (a-w) the repeats locations within the affected gene are indicated (red box). As indicated in thefigure legend, different AUG-like alternative start codons and STOP codons are marked in the sequence preceding the repeats. Potential frameshifting sites are indicated by a black line. *-Neither ATXN8 nor ATXN8OS contain a conventional ORF. Figure S3 . Constructs used in frameshifting studies. 10
body_text.section: Figure S2. In silico Structure Modeling of Transcripts with Expanded Repeats

FIGREF2.text: inclusions of polyGlyPro, polyGlyAla andpolyGlyArg within granule cells of cerebellum, dentate gyrus granule cells and CA4 pyramidal cells of the hippocampus (polyAlaPro-rare and weak immunostaing); polyProArg antibody immunostains chromatin granules in Purkinje cells and anti-polyGlyPro-CT-S (detect the CT region of the sense polyGlyPro proteins), anti-polyGlyArg, anti-polyGlyArg-CT, anti-polyGlyAlawith anti-polyGlyArg, anti-polyGlyArg-CT, anti-plyGlyAla-CT, anti-polyGlyPro-CT-S, anti-polyProAla, anti-polyProAla-CT, anti-polyProArg, anti-polyProArg-CT, anti-polyGP-granular dot like, star-like, ring-like appearance) abundant in the cerebellum, moderate to numerous in the neocortical regions and hippocampus, absent to abundant in the striatum and substantia nigra, absent or sparse in the spinal cord; co--like cytoplasmic inclusions being abundant in all neocortical areas, hippocampus and cerebellum, moderate in subcortical nuclei and low in brainstem and spinal immunohistochemistry; IF-immunofluorescence; WB-western blot, DB-dot blot; NA-not analyzed; DRPs-dipeptide repeat proteins C9ALS -amyotrophic lateral sclerosis with a repeat expansion in C9ORF72 gene C9FTD -frontotemporal lobar degeneration with a repeat expansion in C9ORF72 gene C9MND -motor neurone disease with a repeat expansion in C9ORF72 gene C9HpScl -hippocampal sclerosis with a repeat expansion in C9ORF72 gene HSD -hippocampal sclerosis dementia *-Drosophila model of FXTAS -flies expressing a construct containing 5'UTR region from the FXTAS patient with CGG repeats placed upstream of the coding region of GFP in the GGC glycine encoding frame **-FXTAS mouse model by Entezam et al.2007, which posesses a greater region of mouse 5' UTR surrounding the CGG repeat, including a TAAstop codon 18 bp 5' of the repeat in the glycine frame ***-FXTAS mouse model by Willemsen et al.2003, which does not posess a TAA stop codon 18 bp 5' of the repeat in the glycine frame within 5' UTR of FMR1
